lines.text: Try not to trip me up with those big feet, please.
I'll try, Daffy.
We're on!
[first lines]

[a taxi pulls up to a theatre and Daffy steps out]
How much, my good man?
Uh, one block, 25 cents.
25 cents? It's robbery, but I'll pay it.
There can only be one explanation for white tile in a dressing room.
[Daffy turns a sign around on door, that reads MEN]
And that's it.

[as Daffy is booby-trapping Bugs' xylophone]
When he strikes this note, instead of a xylophone, he'll be playing a harp.
[Daffy does an evil laugh]
[last lines; Daffy has blown himself up for a grand finale; the audience cheers]

[starts clapping]
That's terrific, Daffy! They loved it. They want more.

[as a ghost rising to heaven]
I know, I know, but I can only do it once.
But Daffy, we bill according to drawing power.
Oh, yeah? That rabbit couldn't draw flies if he was covered with syrup. Okay, this performance will prove I'm a star.

[after Daffy concludes his dance, he was not applauded]
Ingrates!

[shouts]
Don't applaud him! Look! I'm not cut in half! Stop applauding! It's a fake!
[When Daffy lifts his torso, he realizes that Bugs did saw him in half]

[to the audience]
Good thing I got Blue Cross.
